page.title: 06The seasons in Uyeasound.
page.content: Autumn is called Hairst in Shetland,it means the harvest and it is a short season.AS there are few trees,Autumn is not very noticeable.Spring is called Voar and it follows a long,dark Winter and it comes late.Suddenly everyone is out of doors.During the Summer the days are long and at Mid-Summer it is the time of the Simmer Dim.This is the twilight of a Shetland Summer night when it remains light for almost all the 24 hours of the day and night. I like Summer best because you can go fishing and sail model boats and go hunting for rabbits and rats.It stays light all the time and in the school holidays and at weekends you can stay up late and have barbeques.
